tool.name: Droplet barcode rank plot
tool.description: Creates a barcode rank plot for quality control of droplet single-cell RNA-seq data

param.name: type
param.label: Input MTX-format matrix?
param.help: Barcode frequencies will be calculated for you. The alternative is to provide barcode frequencies directly

param.name: mtx_matrix
param.label: Matrix-market format matrix file, with cells by column (overrides --barcode-frequencies if supplied)

param.name: cellsbyrow
param.label: For use with --mtx-matrix: force interpretation of matrix to assume cells are by row, rather than by column (default)

param.name: barcode_frequencies
param.label: A two-column tab-delimited file, with barcodes in the first column and frequencies in the second

param.name: label
param.label: Label to place in plot title

param.name: density_bins
param.label: Number of bins used in barcode count frequency distribution

param.name: roryk_multiplier
param.label: Above-baseline multiplier to calculate roryk threshold

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Given a barcode freqeuncy table or an MTX-format matrix from which one can be calculated, produces a barcode rank plot to assess distinctness of droplets with cells over those without (a key mark of good-quality droplet single-cell RNA-seq data).
Thresholds are calculated and plotted, either with DropletUtils or by custom method discussed at https://github.com/COMBINE-lab/salmon/issues/362#issuecomment-490160480.
**Inputs**
* two-column tab-delimted text file with barcode frequencies OR an MTX-format matrix file
-----
**Outputs**
* PNG-format plot file.
